author: abarghoud
message:
feat(docs-infra): use Record type instead of key-value (#40463)

use Record type instead of key-value

Closes #39804

PR Close #40463

files.patch: @@ -150,7 +150,7 @@ The following table summarizes class binding syntax. "my-class-1 my-class-2 my-class-3" - {[key: string]: boolean | undefined | null} + Record<string, boolean | undefined | null> {foo: true, bar: false} @@ -248,7 +248,7 @@ The following table summarizes style binding syntax. "width: 100px; height: 100px" - {[key: string]: string | undefined | null} + Record<string, string | undefined | null> {width: '100px', height: '100px'} @@ -362,4 +362,4 @@ Another example is the [RouterOutlet](api/router/RouterOutlet) directive, which Remember, use [@Input()](api/core/Input) when you want to keep track of the attribute value and update the associated property. Use [@Attribute()](api/core/Attribute) when you want to inject the value of an HTML attribute to a component or directive constructor. - \ No newline at end of file +
